A red glow enveloped Katie’s eyes, as it did Rusenkov’s. The ballerina’s taut body relaxed. Only then will you stop, my little glutton. You’ll gaze down in confusion at yourself. Johnny used his bird form to glide effortlessly and gracefully down from the high-rise window over the darkened city streets. The windows of the buildings gave a bit of light here and there as a janitor worked the night shift or somebody stayed late at the office, but it was nearly 10 PM, and much of the city had begun to slumber, or at least left work. Johnny floated about as he fluttered his wings in search of a place to stop and, looking around, he saw an upscale restaurant or bar of some kind. The restaurant was next to a big office building filled with accounting firms and law practices. Those were high-stress jobs that bred many sleepless nights and broken relationships, and this restaurant, called “The Warehouse” according to the big but tasteful neon sign out front, was the place many who worked in that office building went to blow off steam. Johnny glided down to street level and, as he landed, he shifted back into the form of Jack, the unlucky (or perhaps really lucky) lad whose body he had stolen.


Johnny stood on the street in Jack’s body and looked around as he heard a bit of noise coming from inside. Suddenly, he herd glass shatter and looked in the direction of the noise. An older, disheveled homeless man lay sprawled out in an alley looking at Johnny with his eyes widened with terror. He’d apparently seen Johnny shape-shift and, of course, was in shock over it. He had dropped his whiskey bottle, hence the sound of breaking glass. “What the fuck are you looking at?” Johnny said, his voice dripping with annoyance as though he barely tolerated this mortal’s existence. The man wobbled his way to his feet and ran off as quickly as his drunken body could manage. “The nerve of some people,” Johnny mused as the man fled in horror.


Johnny slowly walked up to one of the shop windows and beheld his reflection. There he beheld Jack’s body. Jack was a fit young man but not very big. He had toned arms and a flat stomach but a height of only perhaps five foot seven or so, and he had pretty green eyes with glasses, and also short dark hair. His fit and handsome but somewhat boyish and meek appearance probably contributed to his being shy. Johnny looked down at his body as he took it in, and he rubbed his hand over Jack’s chin and noted that the young man’s face was smooth. Despite being eighteen, Jack wasn’t able to grow a particularly impressive amount of facial hair; Johnny wondered if he even had to shave often at all. “Kid must be a pretty late bloomer,” Johnny mused as he looked upon a body that seemed subject to a certain measure of arrested development.


Johnny concentrated for a moment, and black smoke engulfed his borrowed boy, swirling about all over him. When the smoke dissipated, the body’s college bar clothes were replaced with a nice black suit and a white dress shirt plus a nice tie. Shining black shoes adorned Johnny’s feet. “Looking good kid,” the demon said to his reflection, the one he had at least for now. “I should fit right in at this fancy joint,” he said as he turned and walked toward the door of the restaurant and into it.

Opening the door, Johnny was assaulted by a plethora of obvious class and elegance. Looking about, he saw that the room was filled with men in expensive suits and women in wonderful evening gowns, often dripping with jewelry. This upscale building had an apt name, as it seemed it had actually been a warehouse at some point, probably housing various industrial goods when the economy still needed them instead of laptops and iPhones.

Jonny nodded with a look of understanding. "Not a problem," he said as he placed his hand on Trask's shoulders. "Do me a favor, son. Find out who the new chief will be and give me their info. I want to publicly wish them luck."

"Yes sir!" Trask said with a smile as Jonny handed him one of the general's business cards. Jonny smiled. General Ricks was in such an authoritative position that he didn't even have to control the young officer into getting that information. If Jonny kept Ricks as his primary meatsuit, things would certainly be easy for him.

"Thank you very much son" Jonny said as he left the building and walked back into the parking lot. In a puff of smoke, Jonny vanished and reappeared in Katie's office in the Warehouse.

"OMG! You scared me!" Katie exclaimed, nearly jumping from her seat. "Nice new threads. A bit rusty, though" she said with a grin.

"This body may just be the most useful one I'll get. The reach I have with him is enough to warrant looking past his age. Besides..." the general's body suddenly shifted as he became what Ricks would have looked like in his mid 30s. "I can be as handsome as I want" he said with a smile.

"Okay, you've got me" Katie said with a shrug. "So what brings you here?"

"I'll be leaving this town soon to return to the military base. I've had enough of things here and this meatsuit will let me have lots of fun. But before I go, I want to make sure that this town is left in capable hands. How's business been here?"

"Terrible. I have a feeling no one will be coming in anymore after this place made the news with Selina's capture" Katie said with a pouting expression on her face. "And after all the work I put into it..."

"Well, it's a good thing I have other plans for you then."

"Oh? Care to fill me in on these other plans?" Katie asked, raising an eyebrow curiously.

"Well, there's going to be a new chief of police in the near future. I don't know who they are, but I'm going to find out as soon as possible. When I do, I want you to leave your current meatsuit and take theirs. You get to be the head of police and your whole 'lord of sin' powers will be very useful from that position. And since I'd assume you'll have your toy Vanessa still, you have underworld access as well. You will literally be running this whole town. What do you say?"

Katie frowned. "Well, I'm going to miss Katie's body a lot...But this is one hell of a promotion!" she exclaimed happily.

"I thought you'd like it. I'll contact you when I have more information" Jonny said as his body reverted back to it's proper age before he disappeared in a puff of black smoke, only to reappear just outside of Lisa's house. Jonny frowned. "This isn't where I wanted to go..." he said, looking at the large house and remembering the times that were had there.

"But it's where I wanted you to go, Jonny" a booming voice said. Jonny turned around to be face to face with the Old Man. "How are you feeling?"

Jonny stared at the Old Man and thought for a moment. The being he was looking at was the most powerful in existence. He could create or destroy demons with a thought. He was responsible for the devouring of Lisa's soul and for all the death and destruction that Jonny had been responsible for. He was the reason for Jonny's current existence.

Jonny knelt one one knee and smiled at his master, the one that gave him true life. "I feel good. Free."

"I thought you might," the Old Man said with a smile motioning for Jonny to rise. "When I created you as a demon, I did not realize that your humanity was still prevalent in your being. Lisa was able to awaken that humanity and nurture it. But in devouring her, you also devoured that humanity. Your being has been purified. Now you are ready to embrace your purpose."

"Yes, master" Jonny said. "I see now how much of a fool I was. Emotions are meaningless and detract from my purpose as a demon. Love is a lie. Pleasure is all that is important."

"Spoken like a true demon. What shall you be doing now?"

Jonny smiled. "I'm going to ensure that Jack, the demon currently in a meatsuit named Katie, is in an ideal position in this town. And then I will leave and have fun with my new life. Until it starts to bore me and I move on again. But first..." Jonny looked at the house. His eyes burned red as the house became engulfed in black flames. "No reason to keep that eyesore in existence" he said.

The Old Man smiled. "Good. I'll be watching you, Jonny" he said before disappearing. Rather than teleporting away, Jonny stayed and watched the engulfed house. As he watched it burn to ash, the memories of his experiences with Lisa played in his mind. The love and loss that Jonny had experienced taught him a valuable lesson. Humans were only useful as toys.

General Cyrus Ricks sat at the desk of his makeshift office, typing away at his computer. He was finishing his report of the events that had transpired in this city since his arrival. He wrote about the trial of the former chief of police, which ended in an order of execution for Selina McCarthy. He concluded his report with the statement that he would be heading back to his base immediately after wishing luck to the soon-to-be-appointed new police chief. As soon as he sent the report to his superior at the White House, General Ricks closed his laptop. He smiled when he heard the knock on his door a few minutes later.

"General Ricks, Officer Nelson is here to see you" Allison Graves said from outside.

"Wonderful! Please send her right in!" The possessed General exclaimed, loud enough to ensure that he was heard through the closed door. He stood up and walked towards the opening door just in time to see Brenda Nelson walk in. "It's nice to finally meet you. I've heard a lot about your love for justice, Officer Nelson" he said as he extended his hand.

"The pleasure is mine, General. Please call me Brenda" Nelson said, taking his hand in hers and giving it a surprisingly strong shake. "I was surprised that you wanted to speak with me, but I guess this is as good a time as ever for me to give you my own thanks for keeping this city in one piece through all that chaos."

"Chaos...That's an appropriate word for everything we've all been through" Jonny said, nodding to Graves to close the door and lock it from the inside as he released Brenda's hand. "But it's not over yet" he said ominously as he looked over the soon-to-be-chief. He had read her file before finishing his report, but the words could not do her justice. Brenda Nelson was 45 years old, but she managed to look remarkably good for her age. Her body was kept in superb shape, leaving it to no wonder that new male officers would always talk about her behind her back. While her moral code was firm, Jonny had no doubt that her body's future occupant would quickly make her into the cougar of the force, an image which got General Ricks' body quite excited.

Brenda nodded. "Of course. We still have a lot to do to get things back to normal. I'll do my best to make it a quick and easy process for everyone involved" she said as Graves crossed her arms, standing behind her, in front of the closed door.

"I'm sure that you will. Everything from the record of your work that I've read to the sense of justice that you're displaying right now has shown me that that is the case. That's why I need to replace you with someone a little more to my liking before leaving" Jonny said as he snapped his finger. Suddenly, Allison Graves' body fell limply to the floor as black smoke exited her mouth and nose. Brenda turned around and opened her mouth to scream as the smoke lunged into her open mouth, forcing its way down her throat. Brenda fell to the ground and shook violently as the smoke made its way further inside of her body. Once it was completely gone, Brenda stood up and brushed herself off, making sure to feel herself over in the process. Her eyes were glowing bright red as the demon completed his takeover. "How's she feel, Jack?" Jonny asked with a grin on his face.

Earlier in the morning, Jonny brought Graves with him to the warehouse to visit Katie. He wasted no time having Jack leave Katie's body and make Graves his temporary meatsuit, though he was very strict that Jack would not make any mental changes to her or devour her soul. She was Jonny's toy and Jack was only allowed to use her until getting to his next stop. Katie's soulless body was commanded to keep running the Warehouse as if nothing was different and report anything interesting to the new police chief.

"Well, I don't like her as Katie or that assistant of yours...but she'll be fun.She's a nice change of pace for me" the newly-possessed Brenda said with an evil smile, as the red glow in her eyes faded back to her natural brown color.

"As the chief of police AND queen of sin, I expect nothing less than the complete corruption of this city and its police force by the next time I hear from you. It's a big job, but I have faith in you" Jonny said as Graves' body stirred. She stood up, holding her head. "Are you alright Graves? Do you need something to drink?"

"N-no, sir. I don't know what happened..." Graves said truthfully. As far as she was concerned, she suddenly got lightheaded and had to sit down for a few minutes. She happened to stay in the room to hear her general wish the new police chief luck and give her some advice, but nothing out of the ordinary. She quickly unlocked the door and headed back to her desk as the general escorted Brenda out of the base.

1351222111122111111111211221121212212111.content:
Jonny reappeared on a beach several miles outside of the city. It was the same beach where the Old Man made him devour Lisa's soul. The same beach that lead to Jonny finally giving up on his humanity and fully embracing his role as a demon of chaos. How many people had he killed in the explosion that followed? How many families were forever changed, how many lives were forever ruined, thanks to the actions of one demon throwing a tantrum?

Jonny crossed General Ricks' hands behinds his back and watched the waves crash, content in his thoughts. He had to admit that it would be strange leaving this city. Ever since the Old Man told him that he had a special mission, Jonny had called this place his home. It was the first area touched by his demonic powers. Jonny wondered where his original group had gone. What became of Kal and the Calhouns? Were they still together or had they decided to go their separate ways and spread their chaos on their own? Jonny also wondered what the Old Man was doing. Was he making new demons? Would one of them be an "alpha" like Jonny? Would they suffer the same fate and have to get their humanity ripped from them in the same way? All of these were questions that Jonny knew he would likely never get the answers to. The Old Man was more powerful than any demon. He was something greater than anything that existed.

"He is also weaker now than he ever was, Jonathan Macks" a voice said. Jonny nearly jumped of surprise as he turned to find an older woman standing next to him. She had long blonde hair that was starting to grey and had on a long purple dress with a matching scarf on her head. She looked to be about the same age as the general that Jonny currently inhabited. "You must be wondering who I am" she said, turning to look at Jonny, her eyes a bright purple. Jonny nodded, but said nothing. "Well," she continued, "you can call me Lena. Alternatively, I suppose you can call me the 'Old Woman'" she said with a chuckle, causing Jonny to raise his eyebrow. "It's true that I'm not as old as my father, but I don't have to be to be old, wise, and powerful. I've existed for a very long time, watching as he made his demons and fed on his chaos. It's a viscous cycle, you know."

"What do you mean?" Jonny asked, finally joining this conversation. He couldn't help but admit that he was curious who this woman was and what she wanted.

"My father is immortal, but he is not ageless. He was once an angel that found himself cast out of heaven. In order to survive away from Grace, he had to create an energy source for himself. That energy source was chaos, which he harvests with the demons that he creates. The energy from that chaos keeps him in existence but he always ends up using more power than he generates. That's why, every once in awhile, he creates an alpha with the potential to have the same powers as he does. He'll let them generate and gain power from chaos and then adsorb them into himself to bring his power back to maximum. Once that happens he replenishes all the demons that got themselves destroyed over the years and then has to make a new alpha to get himself back in shape. You are only the latest in a chain, Jonny."

"Why are you telling me all this?"

"Because I want you to help me break the cycle," she said, placing her hand on Jonny's shoulder and looking into his eyes. "I've been watching you from the very beginning. The Old Man tried to erase your humanity by making you kill the woman who you fell in love with and he mistook your anger at the world for success. But that anger wasn't because your humanity was ripped out of you. It was because of your passion. I know that your humanity is still strong inside of you, Jonny. You may have lied to yourself and said that it's not, but you came here, to this beach, because you still care. I've traveled to many different realities to meet you, Jonny. All of them as an enemy trying to win you to my cause by force because I could not bring myself to believe that you had any shred of humanity left in you. But seeing you now made me realize that you are more human than I ever was when I was a mortal. I don't want to be your enemy, Jonny. I want to be your friend. I want to help you eliminate the Old Man so that no one else has to suffer the way that you have. Will you help me do that? Or will you be my enemy like in every other reality I found myself in?"

Jonny thought for a moment. He didn't know what this woman was talking about about alternate realities, but he did know that she was right about his humanity. He may have tried to convince himself that it was burned out of him, but if that were true, he would not have brought himself to this beach. Somehow, he managed to maintain connection to himself that other demons did not. He imagined what happened with him and Lisa happening to others and balled his hand into a fist. He looked at Lena sternly. "I'll help you, Lena. Where do we start?"

This reality is the only one where you have retained enougb of your humanity to be able to help me. So this is the reality where my mission must come to an end. Now before you ask any more questions, please possess Leah's body. Sbe's perfectly willing."

Jonny briefly thought this over and came to the conclusion that it was best to do as he was asked. He concentrated and left General Ricks' body, which fell limply to the floor as his smoky form rushed itself into Leah's mouth, which she had opened for him. Her body gave no fight whatsoever as he entered. In fact, upon beginning his possession of Leah, Jonny found himself met with a very familiar feeling power which pulled him in even faster. Opening his new eyes, Jonny saw Lena leaning over the General, whispering something into his ear as he stood up and stood at attention next to Allison Graves. When Jonny was about to ask what was said, he felt a pain in his head. The pain was so strong, he began to scream as he fell to the ground, blacking out.

*****

Jonny woke up what he assumed was several hours later. He was laying in a very comfortable bed in what he assumed was the mansion that he was outside of the last time he was conscious. He sat up and looked down at himself, seeing that he was still inside of Leah's body, but had changed from the gown she wore earlier into a simple t-shirt and sweatpants.

"Ah, I see that you've woken up" Lena said as she entered the room and sat on a chair next to the bed which Jonny sat on. "If your mind clear now?"

Jonny nodded. "It is" he said, remembering the information that had entered his mind, which caused him to pass out in the first place.

"Good. Then explain it to me so I know you understand" Lena said, offering Jonny a glass of tea which seemed to just appear out of nowhere.

Jonny shook his said, feeling Leah's long hair moving back and forth as he did so. "No thanks" he said softly. "Before I do, where are the general and Allison?"

Lena smiled, keeping the tea with herself and taking a slow sip. "Oh, they left a little over an hour ago. I fixed up their memories so they assumed a wrong turn was taken and their GPS wasn't working. They stopped here to ask for directions and I made sure they didn't leave without a bite to eat first. Now tell me what you know." The way Lena said that last part betrayed a slightly impatient tone. As if she were in a hurry.

"Once I possessed Leah, her memories became clear to me. In the reality you brought her from, her body was possessed by a demon, like you said. But that demon was me. You used your magic on me and erased my personality, merging my soul with Leah's and making me believe that I was her just with access to demonic powers. Then you taught her magic with the hopes of training her to destroy the old man with that combination. But it didn't work. When I possessed her before, my demonic powers merged with her magical ones and combined with the version of me that possessed her initially. I'm the only soul in this body and I have the combined powers of two alpha demons and a sorceress in training. I take it you think I'm finally enough to destroy him or you wouldn't have sacrificed Leah's life like that..."

Lena nodded. "I did what I had to in order to get you where you now are. I told you I tried getting you on my side in other ways and turning you into Leah was one of them. It worked in getting you to my side, but your powers were still not good enough. And the humanity you had in you was one that I forced upon you. The version of you from this reality was clearly the best option to give these powers to. So here we are. You can either spend time planning revenge on me for what I did to the alternate version of you, or we can destroy the Old Man. Make your choice, but do it fast since we don't have much time."

Jonny sighed. Obviously destroying the Old Man was the choice he'd make, but he wasn't convinced that these means were justified. But he'd have time to deal with Lena after destroying the Old Man. "Where is he?" Jonny asked.

1351222111122111111111211221121212212111.content:
Lena grinned slyly. "Oh, you must already have an idea where he is, Jonny."

Jonny nodded. "You seemed to be in a rush to get me on the same page as you. In addition to that, you wouldn't be so confident in this plan unless you knew he wasn't able to barge in and stop it. You have him prisoner somehow, right?"

"Bingo" Lena said, handing Jonny a crystal ball. Jonny took it and looked inside, seeing dark energy within it, trying to break free. The ball also had a crack in it, showing that he had at least some success so far. As Jonny took it in his hand, a second crack appeared. "Just before getting you, I took a new body from the same reality that I brought Leah from. That body have me more powers which I used to make my spell stronger. But he can still break free. You need to destroy him before he can do that or all is lost" Lena said, putting her hand to her face and peeling off her older appearance. Beneath that older skin was the face of Lisa! "Without her master, Lisa would have lived the rest of her life miserable on that world. She allowed me to take her body and use her life force to power the magic which currently keeps the Old Man trapped. Do not waste time and allow her sacrifice to be for naught" she said, now in Lisa's voice as her eyes glowed bright purple.

Jonny was too strong for any of her powers to affect him in his current state, but Jonny knew that Lena knew she had nothing to fear from him. Jonny was already planning how to get revenge on Lena for her actions towards the alternate versions of him and Lisa, but for now he knew that he had to focus on the Old Man that he had in his hands. Jonny closed his eyes and used his power to replicate the power of the demon nearest him, which was now the Old Man. He felt the Old Man's power within him and all of his abilities and suddenly, Jonny knew what he had to do. He placed the crystal ball against Leah's chest and felt a warmth escaping from the crystal ball as a third crack appeared. He pressed it against himself harder now, causing the ball to suddenly enter inside of Leah's skin. He heard the Old Man screaming in pain and then felt a burning sensation throughout Leah's entire body. Leah's skin burnt away as Jonny became a pillar of darkness, combining his increased demonic powers with that of the Old Man.

Lena watched as the demonic energy then concentrated itself in one location and formed a human body. It was a male body in his early thirties, wearing a police uniform that was at least a few decades outdated. "Welcome back" Lena said, still using Lisa's voice as he stood up and walked over to the newly formed man. "Do you see the big picture now, master?"

Jonny nodded, finally understanding everything now that the Old Man's essence had combined with his. Everything had been part of this plan from the start. He wrapped his arm around the possessed-alternate-Lisa's body, resting it on the small of her back and pulling her close. "Thank you, Lena. And goodbye" Jonny said as his newly made eyes glowed bright red. Lena screamed as her body disintegrated into magical energy which then returned to Jonny's body. "I'm sorry, Lisa" he said as walked in front of the mirror and looked at his reflection. He concentrated and watched as the policeman's uniform he was wearing changed into a black suit with an overcoat above it and his hat changed into a black fedora. He now looked almost exactly like the Old Man, but decades younger. With his magical powers, he would be able to easily travel through time and to alternate realities while his demonic powers would allow him to take mortal souls and make them like him. When Lena told him about the cycle that the Old Man always went through, she was talking about this. Jonny lived his mortal life and became a demon, only to eventually become the singularity he now was and create himself. Over time, the powers he acquired would get weaker, causing an aged appearance. That would signal the time for this cycle to restart.

With that, man who could no longer be described as a human or a demon but simply an entity concentrated on using his powers to explore different times and realities, creating demons along the way. The circle must continue after all.

1351222111122111111111211221121212212111.content:
Somewhere around the time that darkness still covered the city and General Ricks's possessed body lay down in his opulent hotel room, Selina McCarthy huddled in an alley outside an apartment complex and shivered in the cold of the waning night. The curvy chief's hands rubbed her bare arms as she tried to keep warm but still shivered. Jonny had placed upon her middle-aged body a sexy black dress that left little to the imagination but plenty to the elements, and Selina was now paying for that decision even though she did not make it.


Selina stumbled, panicked, through the alley outside an apartment building somewhere in the city. "Dammit!" she said as she bumped into a garbage can and sent in tumbling, her balance thrown off by the sexy high heels Jonny had put on her. Suddenly, Selina spied a police cruiser and an army jeep rolling suspiciously down the street together. She dove behind a rusty old dumpster and lay down on her belly. She peeked around the corner of the dumpster just barely as the lights of the police cruiser probed about the darkened corners of the alley, illuminating garbage and the occasional scurrying rat. Sweat formed on Selina's forehead as her heart quickened, but the cars and their accompanying light soon passed.


"What the hell happened to me?!" Selina said as she clenched her fists and scampered back up from her hiding spot. She shuffled her way to a flight of stairs and up to the first level, still rubbing her arms to stop the cold from biting at her. Selina then stumbled like a crazed drunk down a hallway on the second level of the apartment building. Her heels echoed in the hallway as she headed haphazardly toward the middle of the building away from the balconies on the outside of the building and, rather importantly, away from the prying eyes of passers-by. There, Selina slowly sank down in a corner where not much light was to be found. She closed her eyes and tried to get some rest and hoped not to be discovered. She tried to calm her mind, and this was the first real sleep she had attempted in days. She needed the rest. Was all this real?


Within a few minutes of trying to doze off, Selina jumped and her eyes shot open as an apartment door a few feet away swung open. Out of the room stepped a young boy of about seven. He had curly blonde hair and an Iron Man set of pajamas. "I think I left it out her--" the boy started, apparently looking for a toy or something of the sort. The boy's eyes scanned the fairly dark hallway. As soon as he saw Selina, he jumped. "Wha--who--" he began, his voice shaking as he backed away. The last thing Selina needed was for this little kid to scream and alert everybody to her presence. "Hi there!" Selina said to the young boy with a broad smile on her face, "what's your name?" she asked. The boy stared at her for a few seconds, probably having been told never to talk to strangers, certainly not scantily-clad ones outside his apartment in dark corners of the building at night.


The boy stood afraid for a few more seconds before he seemed to relax. "My--my name's Tommy," he said meekly, "What's yours?" Selina smiled. "I'm Selina," she said as she extended her hand and shook Tommy's. She'd had to do this sort of thing before. Life as a cop put her in contact with a lot of kids who just happened to be at the house where a drug bust occurred or perhaps a whore house where some of the hookers had kids. This was the ugly part of the job, but Selina's younger days--perhaps 15 or 20 years ago--taught her something about dealing with situations like this. She looked nervously around the hallway and listened intently to the television that was on inside Tommy's apartment. "Tommy, are your parents home?" Tommy shook his head. "My mommy's a nurse at the hospital . . . said she's gotta work late 'cause the army men told her she's got to treat the people hurt in the big boom across town . . . Daddy's gone," Tommy said as he looked down, obviously missing his father. "So you're here all by yourself?" Selina asked. Tommy nodded.


This was no good, and Selina knew it. A kid this young shouldn't be home alone ever, and sure as hell not at a time like this. His mom probably had no choice but to work all the hours she could get--still, this wasn't safe for Tommy. "You're a pretty lady," Tommy said nicely. Selina smiled. "Thank you Tommy, and you're being such a brave big boy handling things here all by yourself. Say, Tommy, since you're the man of the house, do you think you would mind doing a pretty lady a favor?" Selina asked. Tommy nodded pleasantly. "Do you think you could let me come in to your house just for a bit to stay and get warm--I'm pretty cold," Selina said. Tommy thought about it. He had been told not to do such things, but it was awfully cold, and this woman seemed nice. "Okay, come on in!" he said with a smile as he took the tired police chief by the hand and led her into the house.


Selina stepped into the apartment and was greeted by an oh-so-pleasent warmth. Sexy clothes were great, but not in the cold of the night. Truth be told, Selina had another motivation--she couldn't be out in daylight, and daylight fast approached. She figured whoever pursued her could be anywhere, or anyone, and the last thing she wanted to do was be visible. Selina looked about the house. It seemed like the home of a loving mother who could not be home nearly as much as she wanted. Pictures of Tommy and his mom were all over the place, but the place was a mess. There were instructions for Tommy to make his own meals taped to the wall because his mom as unlikely to be home to do it herself. Tommy's clothes were strewn about, as were a few pairs of scrubs that presumably belonged to his mom.


Selina heard a noise and let out a slight yelp as she jumped. Tommy looked at her strangely. "It's okay . . . just the microwave with some pizza roles. Want some?" Tommy said as he removed the things from the microwave. Selina had to calm down--what was wrong with her? She had spent too long as someone else's puppet. She trusted no one--other than Tommy, at the moment. "Um--sure, yeah. Thanks Tommy," Selina said as she walked over and sat down next to Tommy, who kindly allocated half of the pizza roles for himself and the balance for his new friend. "So are you?" Tommy asked. Selina paused, struggling to understand the question. "Oh--you mean my job?" she asked. Tommy nodded. "I'm a policewoman," she said. Now it was Tommy's turn to be confused. He looked Selina up and down. She looked like a hooker. "Did you get new uniforms?" he asked, "or were you undercover?" he whispered with a smile indicating he was enthralled by the idea. "No, no Tommy I--well, see I'm still figuring that part out," Selina said as she tried to put on a brave face. The two munched their pizza rolls in peace.


Now with a bit of warm food in her belly, Selina thanked her young host. "That was a fine meal, young man," she said. She leaned back and stretched and yawned. "Tommy," she began, "I'm real tired. Do you suppose that I could rest in your room?" she asked. Tommy quickly agreed and pointed the way to his room, saying that he would be watching TV. The morning cartoons would be on soon. Selina stood up and walked back to Tommy's room. As she stepped into it, she noted an assortment of Marvel characters adorning the wallpaper. Action figures littered the floor, and Tommy had Captain America sheets on his bed. Selina laughed. It had been a long time since she had slept in such a small bed. Still, she lay down and pulled the covers over her buxom body as sunlight began to creep through the closed curtains. She tried to drift off the sleep and enjoy, however tenuously, her control over a body that had not been hers in some time. At least she could pass some time here. Who knew when Tommy's mom would return and how she would react, but it was better than being outside and paranoid.

Her eyes fluttered open, and Tommy stood expectantly at the side of a bed that, to be fair, was his anyway. "Hey big man," Selina said with a smile. "Feel better?" Tommy asked. Selina nodded. "What's up?" she asked. "Well," Tommy began, "my mommy says I gotta ask her before I have milk and cookies, and I want some, but mommy's not here, so since you're kinda a grown-up like my mommy maybe I should ask you--can I have some milk and cookies?" he said. Selina laughed. It was cute that he'd mustered the self-control to ask. Selina would not have managed that at his age. "Sure," she chuckled. "And can you have some with me?" he said. Tommy was clearly lonely . . . he wanted attention, and a kid this age should really have somebody around. Selina nodded with a smile as she got up from Tommy's bed and headed for the kitchen.


Tommy pointed his new friend to the location of the milk glasses and where his mom hid the cookies, or at least where she put them thinking they were hidden. Selina got out both and poured two glasses of milk, setting the cookies on the table. She sat down, as Tommy already had. "Do you know how to eat 'em?" he asked, "they're oreo cookies," he explained. Selina was pretty sure she knew what he was talking about, but she decided to humor him. "What do you mean?" she asked. Tommy carefully took the top of the cookie and twisted it off, leaving only the bottom half with the filling. He then dipped the top half of the cookie into the milk glass and ate it. He then did the same with the bottom half. "My uncle taught me," he said, "I like these cookies 'cause they're the only kind it works with." Selina smiled, trying it herself. The top half snapped in two as she tried to take it off. "That happens sometimes, but you'll get the hang of it," he said, optimistic. "Well as long as I've got you to teach me, I'm sure I'll be fine," she said kindly. Tommy smiled.


Tommy actually devoured most of the oreo cookies in the container. Crumbs were scattered around his mouth. He leaned back with a full belly at the end of the session. His stomach stuck out a little bit--apparently he could cook, but could not cook healthy food. His belly was a bit pudgy. "Did you like them?" Tommy said. Selina nodded pleasantly.


Suddenly, there came a knock at the door. "Open up! Police!" came the familiar call. Selina's eyes widened. She looked panicked at Tommy. She hated to drag him into this, but she saw no other choice. "Tommy," she said in a worried whisper, "I gotta hide, and you have to tell them you're alone!" she said, scared as she stood up and tried to scurry off in the direction of his room. Tommy tilted his head in confusion. "I thought you were a police lady?" he said. Selina again shushed him, knowing she had to be quiet, "Just do it! You gotta help me! Please!" she said as she shuffled back and close the door to Tommy's room as quietly as she could. From there, Selina listened.


Tommy got up from the table and went to the door, opening it. "Hey there little fella," said a single male voice that Selina thought sounded familiar, "what's your name?" "Tommy," came the answer. "I'm Sargent Grubman," said the man. That was it! Selina had known this cop for years--good guy, very by-the-book, but always nice. He was about sixty years old with a white mustache and a bulging, bouncing belly from way too many doughnuts over the years. Selina never saw him the in the gym. He was short too--a body that short wasn't made to carry his girth. "Are you here all by yourself?" Grubman asked. "Yes," Tommy responded. "Are you all right? Do you need anything?" the officer inquired. Tommy went on to explain the reason for his mother's absence but also noted the bountiful provisions he had in the house, making sure to mention the cookies he so loved. Selina stood with her ear agains the door in his room as sweat formed on her forehead. She hoped he would buy it.

Selina knelt down on Tommy's blue carpet, her ear on the wooden door that separated her from Tommy Sargent Grubman. There was silence for a few seconds after Tommy explained anything. Selina could mentally imagine the scene outside. Grubman, the old and fat cop, was probably looking into Tommy's eyes with a look of unspoken accusation. That was a common strategy that Selina herself used on more than one occasion to convince younger witnesses to tell her the truth. She also imagined Tommy staring defiantly up at Grubman, not telling him anything. Atleast, she hoped that was what he was doing. Selina could afford to be hopeful about this since there was no sound of a conversation going on out there.

In the silence, Selina looked down at herself, seeing the fine dress hugging the curves of her body. She wished that she could have met Tommy in clothing that was more of her style. even though she always knew that she had a good figure, Selina had always been careful to dress modestly and never flaunt herself around, feeling that such behavior was incredibly unbecoming for someone in her position. Despite the fact that she admittedly loved the way she looked in this dress, it just wasn't her. But then again, she hadn't exactly been herself in a very long time, had she? Memories flashed through her mind, hurting her head a bit. This had been happening regularly since she woke up in the Warehouse. At first, Selina chalked it up to a bad dream from being knocked out, but then they just kept coming. Flashes of things here and there. First she remembered meeting Jonny. She recalled his eyes glowing and then her thoughts changing...did he do something to her, put her under a spell of some kind? As time went on, she remembered more. She remembered a strange man talking to her, and then black smoke leaving him and forcing its way into her. That should have been all Selina could remember, but when Jonny was made to devour Lisa's soul, the emotional stress he was under, caused some sort of psychic bleed over. Selina remembered things that Jonny had done in his body and knew that the black formless smoke was actually Jonny. She also got a little bit of Jonny;s thoughts from when he was in her body, telling her that Jonny was never actually just a kid. He was a powerful demon who enslaved her best friend and then wore her own body like the dress that she was now wearing. Selina clenched her fists. She wanted revenge on this monster for taking away her life and for potentially killing her best friend, but she didn't know how she could do that. Jonny could be anyone right now and she had no clues. All she knew was that she had to get out of this dress and that she had to find a place that she could hide out for awhile and wait things out.

Suddenly, Selina's thoughts were interrupted by Grubman's laughing. "Thanks for the milk kid! Be careful in here. There's a dangerous fugitive on the loose and we're going to need your help to catch her, so stay inside and stay safe. If anything happens, let me know!" he said as Selina heard the sound of an empty milk glass hitting the table and then the door closes. Selina had been so lost in her thoughts that she didn't even hear the conversation. What had Grubman said to Tommy? Selina opened the door slowly to see Tommy looking up at her.

"Selina? Are you a bad lady?" Tommy asked innocently.

Selina just knelt down on one knee again so that she could be at Tommy's height. She knew that she wasn't a bad person, but there was no doubt that she had done bad things while her body was under Jonny's control and she certainly didn't currently look like a good police officer. She didn't know how to answer the question right now so she just responded with, "do you think I'm a bad lady, Tommy?"

Tommy shook his small head. "I don't think you're a bad lady, but the big man said you were. He said you made that place go boom" he said, clearly distraught,

Selina sighed, now wanting revenge on Jonny even more. "Tommy, I promise you that I did not do anything like that. I'm a good guy, and the bag guy is making me look like the bad guy right now. I'm being framed, like that time when everyone thought Superman had turned evil but he really hadn't. You remember that right?" She asked, making a reference that she knew the boy would understand.

Tommy smiled a little, feeling reassured. "Yeah, I remember. Can I help you be good again?" he asked eagerly.

Selina smiled warmly at the seven year old. "Right now, all I need is a place to hide and some new clothing. Can you help me with that?"

Tommy nodded. "My mommy has spare clothes in her room" he said sweetly.

"You're the best, Tommy" Selina said, hugging the boy tightly. As Tommy hugged back, something strange started to happen. Selina started to feel dizzy. Her vision was going black. What was happening? Had Jonny found her? Was her body about to be taken over again? Her entire body felt like it was burning apart. Tommy started to get scared and cry. Selina's whole body felt like it was on fire as her skin became replaced by black smoke and flames. Her dress, undergarments and heels fell to the floor in a pile as Selina's entire body was replaced with the smoke which by natural reflex lunged into Tommy's open mouth. The boy's small body shook and choked as the smoke forced it's way all the way down his throat. He fell to the floor unconscious, his body still jerking as the smoke forced itself into control of his body.

After a few moments, Tommy's eyes opened and the boy sat up. "What happened?" He asked and then jumped, noticing his voice. He jumped up and then nearly fell back down. something was wrong. His weight distribution wasn't right. He looked down and instead of seeing two large mounds protruding from his dress covered chest, he saw nothing but the small fully clothed body of a seven year old boy. The dress was on the floor in front of him. "Oh my gosh...I...I possessed him? Am...am I like Jonny?" he wondered aloud, getting used to his new voice as he began pacing around the room, just as hyper as a normal seven year old. He had to figure things out.

Tommy picked up the bundle of clothing from the floor, which was very heavy for his small body, and carried it into his room, hiding it under his bed. With that out of sight, he jumped onto Tommy's bed and looked at his reflection in the mirror. Memories of Tommy's life filled his head, but he also got more flashes of Jonny's thoughts from when the demon had possessed Selina. Suddenly, he knew all about the possession power somehow. Jonny's rage from killing Lisa must have triggered more than just memories to bleed over, but powers as well. Selina could willingly turn her body into demonic smoke and do to others what Jonny had did to her. The last thing she wanted was to steal the life of an innocent child, especially one who had helped her to hide, but this would definitely help her to hide from Jonny and figure out where the demon was. Still, this felt bad...

1351222111122111111111211221121212212111.content:
Selina stood on the bed and looked into the mirror as the young boy's innocent face looked back at her. Behind his eyes was the look his young body's world-weary possessor, full of confusion, fear, and angst, and maybe just a tiny bit of solace. "I'm sorry little guy," she said to her silent companion, "I can't use you like this . . . cookies and comics ought to be the biggest things you worry about," she said. She jumped down from his bed, sure now of what she had to do. She ran through the house with the energy of her young, hyperactive host. She hadn't felt this kind of energy and excitement in over 40 years--since she was a little girl.


She ran through the house to where Tommy's memories told her she'd find his coat and gloves. Removing them from the hanger, she threw on his coat, adorned on its back with an impressive Captain America logo. Selina smiled at her super-hero garb. Indeed, little Tommy had been her knight in shining armor for these last few hours. He had graciously offered her a place to sleep and eat, and he believed in her innocence despite just having met her. Such a thing was rare, she figured. She quickly threw on his gloves and a hat and darted out the door, motoring her little legs and tiny body down the hall as fast as she could. She ran past the doors of the other apartments, noting the conspicuous absence of bouncing on her chest, and seeing also that her head came up only about as far as the knobs on the doors, which was quite different from what she was used to. Selina quickly and haphazardly rounded the corner and began to bound down the stairs, her tiny meat suit breathing heavily as she did.


She came to the next story down and looked down the hallway to the right. The morning sun cut through the cold sky and peered into the otherwise dark hall. The curfew was only in effect at night, so most of the building was empty. Selina could motor around and acclimate herself to this new body in relative solidarity. She then looked to the left down the other side of the hall, and she saw what she had been pursuing. "Well mam, you be sure to give us a ring if that woman does get in contact with you, and make sure to stay in when the curfew kicks in--not safe out there after dark, you see," declared Sargent Grubman in a pleasant voice as the person to whom he spoke silently closed her door. Selina ran up to him. "Mr. Officer Man!" she called out, getting bit of a kick out of the innocence and youth she could not project, "Mr. Police Man!" she said as she ran up to the waiting officer and tapped him on the leg.


Grubman turned with a start toward his pint-sized companion, and a smile crossed his aged, jolly face. "Well hey there Tommy!" he said nicely, "why you look like you've been running--everything all right, little fella?" he asked as he bent down a bit to take a look at the little boy. Selina paused. She wasn't entirely sure how to handle this part. She'd done it before, but of course that had been accidental--could she do it on purpose? Selina gulped. Sargent Grubman cocked his head. "You all right?" he asked. "Sorry, Walt . . . I'll give it back. I promise," Selina said as reached out her little hands and placed them firmly on the policeman's blubber-filled mid-section and concentrated. Within a second or so, the swirling mass of smoke and dust and magic that had become Selina's form began to emerge from Tommy's mouth as his body shook and convulsed. It was as though the little boy was throwing up, but Selina herself was coming out. The spasms and jerks continued as Selina forced her way out of the boy, and the black smoke that emerged almost instinctively and automatically made its way toward the waiting, plump officer.


The dust and smoke and sorcery snaked their way up to the cop's mouth as it hung open in amazement at what he was seeing, and then down it went. Selina forced her way inside the aged cop, his plump, rotund body giving mighty jiggles and bouncing about as she did. He choked and jerked and gasped as he slowly lost control of his own body. His soul tried with no success to fight off the invading presence, each battle manifesting in another jerk or gargle that lasted briefly and then gave way that much more of the cop's body to its new owner. Suddenly, all the struggles stopped, and Grubman's body slumped limply against the wall as Tommy fell with a thump to the ground.


Selina felt strange. She shook her head and closed her eyes, opening them again only to repeat the process a couple more times--like shaking off a sleep. She turned her head slowly toward the wall against which she was leaning, and she saw the first sign that something was dramatically afferent. What she saw was not the dainty, young hand of Tommy, but instead an aged, pudgy hand belonging to a nearly sixty-year-old man. Little bits of hair stuck out from the calloused fingers as Selina beheld them. "Oh my go--" she began, only to note that her voice was quite deep and hoarse. She quickly put her hand to her throat to feel a large, jiggly double chin in the way. Selina slowly stood entirely upright and looked down at herself.


What Selina saw was, yet again, quite different from her expectations. She was not very far off the ground because Walter Grubman was not a particularly tall man--five feet eight inches, if that. Still, years of doughnuts and a stressful job had ballooned his belly, and indeed a mighty gut stuck out from his body and strained against the pressed confines of the police uniform. Selina's new belly jiggled as she stepped, as did a sloppy set of man-boobs that were really just unattractive fat deposits on Officer Grubman's chest. She took a couple steps and felt her body's odd weight distribution. "Well they aren't the boobs I hoped for, but they'll work," she said with a smile as she ran her hand over her bald head and grey mustache and looked down at her unfit body. She slowly turned and looked down at Tommy as he began to stir, moaning a little bit.


"Oh my god--Tommy!" Selina suddenly heard. She looked in the direction of the noise and saw a woman who probably wasn't any older than 23 or 24 herself. Selina quickly studied this woman--she had black hair running down much of her back, and she was roughly Selina's height. She was a little bit chubby--not fat, but with a little extra pouch in her belly and her ass and her thighs, essentially the figure of a woman who probably wanted to keep in shape but whose schedule didn't permit it. The look in the woman's eyes suggested she was tired.


This woman ran up to Tommy as he lay on the floor. "Tommy! Tommy!" she said, "is he all right?" she asked of the plump sergeant before her. "He's my boy," she said as she grabbed him from Selina and held him in her arms. "Oh yes mam. Yes indeed, he's fine. The little tike was running after me to help me probably and, well, he took a little spill and landed wrong--banged his head on the floor as he went down it looked like," Selina said. Even her brief time inside Tommy's body confirmed that this was indeed his mom. "I'm Amber," she said as she swooned over her son. "I'm Sel--I'm ah, I'm Walter Grubman . . . folks call me Walt," Selina declared, finding it odd to refer to herself as her host. "You know, Tommy and I chatted just a few minutes ago--he's a very nice boy, lots of energy and lots of potential. You're lucky to have such a wonderful little guy," Selina said. Amber smiled. "I know," she said, " . . . just wish I could spend more time with him. I'm working as an RN and going to school for my BSN. The money at my job isn't bad, but I work weird hours, and that plus school means I don't get to see my little fella as much as I'd like. I just have to keep doing it for another couple years and then it'll be done--I'l be able to move us into a nice place and get a promotion so I can make my own hours at least a bit more," she explained. Selina smiled. This wasn't an uncommon story, the economy being what it was.


"Wel best of luck to you and Tommy," Selina said, "will you be working again tonight?" "Yes . . . . the explosion freaked everybody out, and they're making us all work overtime in case there's another attack. We have to be caught up when the next thing happens or we'll start off behind," she said. "Well I'll make a point of dropping by and checking on the boy before I go home tonight just to make sure he's all right," Selina said. Amber smiled. "Thank you so much," she said happily. With that, Selina waddled away, ensconced safely (for now) inside the aging, overweight body of Walter Grubman. The uniform felt natural, even if this body filled it out very differently from her own. She thought little Tommy really did need somebody around, somebody to look after him and talk to him--it wasn't good for kids that young to be left totally alone for that long. Plus, Selina could use the shelter--a place to rest and recharge away from the prying eyes of the whole military and police establishment and whoever Johnny might have possessed or otherwise controlled.


Selina lumbered out of the building and got in the police car, fastening the seat belt tightly around her sloppy middle. She took a deep breath and looked in the mirror at her host body. "I'm sorry, Walt, I really am," she said to her vessel, "I'll get out of you when I figure this thing out . . . you're a good guy, and you don't deserve to be used like this, just like I didn't. But you're the one I've got, and you're a good guy. You might even have let me do this if I'd had the occasion to ask you," she said to him. With that, she started up the car and headed off.

1351222111122111111111211221121212212111.content:
Selina rolled through the streets of the city in silence. Every foreign, strange jiggle of her bloated body got her attention. The curfew was not in effect at this hour of the day,--it began at 6--but traffic flow was definitely reduced noticeably. "So strange . . . " Selina marveled in Walt's gravelly but kind voice. She sifted through her host's memories and found many things she had not expected. The very idea of combing through the memories of another human being was strange, but she remembered Walt's first baseball game, his high school graduation (which happened around the time she was born), his first sexual encounter, and so many more things. She could tell how Walt felt about each of these things; it was like reading somebody else's private journal. Selina assumed that Walt probably could not tell that Selina had possessed him. She knew Johnny had been inside her, but that was only because she had seen his vessel for long enough for the memories to bleed over.


Selina made her way toward a convention center in town. The place was right next to a big fancy hotel, and it had become the gathering place for cops who would then be given their marching orders by the military guys who had effectively taken the lead in securing the city and searching for Selina. Selina pulled his host's car into an unused parking space and turned off the engine. She got out of the car and took a deep breath, drawing air into Walt's lungs and expanding his aging belly. Lena had been right—this body did seem a bit more like home to him, but that in itself was a cause for concern. Jonny walked sexily (there was no other way for a woman with a body like Leah’s to walk) through the dusty room as he searched his host’s mind for details of the case with which he should begin. “At least I’ve still got powers while I’m trapped in this body . . . maybe they’ll do me some good currying favor with the boss while I catch bad guys,” Jonny mused. Suddenly, something with a bit of a shine caught Jonny’s eye. He turned and moved in closer to the gleaming thing. “Pretty . . .” he said as he started at the mirror that had given off a faint glow.


Jonny looked into the mirror. “Pretty . . . “ he said again, his voice trailing off like that of someone too mesmerized to think clearly. His knees felt shaky, wobbly. “What’s ha—ha—happening?” Jonny demanded as his host body seemed to rebel against him. Jonny looked down at his form, a look of panic on his face. With one final yank, a mass of smoke flew out of Leah’s mouth and into the swirling mass of magic contained in the mirror Jonny had been looking entranced into. Jonny could discern figures below for a few seconds before he felt himself slam into the earth, or something very near it. Moments after, he felt solid again—like having a body once more. His eyes opened. Above him, he could see a vast and beautiful sky. Birds flew above—except they actually didn’t. As Jonny lay on the ground, he could see birds above him, wings extended as they indeed had to be, but the birds did not seem to move. “Wha—“ Jonny began, only to notice a voice foreign to him. He blinked, reopening his eyes only to see that the birds above him were still unmoving against all odds.


Jonny slowly sat up. He could feel a couple pig-tails hanging down from his head. He looked about. Some distance off was a grave-yard with a big marble or perhaps granite vault. Headstones sat ornately on the ground for some distance around him. There was precisely no breeze. No leaves rustled. No cars drove slowly and respectfully by. There were cars nearby, but they too were still.


Jonny looked down at himself. He saw a dress that hung down from straps perched upon his shoulders. Jonny stood slowly. He held up his hands—he was black, or at least his skin was somewhat dark. The dress was plenty of evidence that he was a woman—a girl, really. There were no breasts, no curves, or anything like that. Jonny’s new vessel was short, probably no more than four and a half feet tall, if that. “What the hel—“ he began as he looked about and saw that nearby was a sizeable group of people in black suits and dresses. It was a funeral or something of the sort. People had tissues and looked sad, though again they were also frozen. Jonny walked toward them to try to figure out what the hell was going on.


It was spooky, really. Jonny felt as though he had been caught in the web of a spider that was just toying with him. He did not even know what body he was in; he sure hadn’t picked it. Hadn’t his captor promised him he would be stuck inside Leah’s body anyway? What the hell was going on?

“There’s my little princess!” came a voice that was scarily familiar. Jonny spun around to view the source. Lena Mesmera walked slowly and sexily toward Jonny—her curvy body barely contained by a tight-fitting corset. Her chest jiggled as she walked. “You!” Jonny yelled, though his young body’s child-like voice made the accusation less than threatening. “Yes, me my lovely little Jonny, or Leah, as you soon will be,” Mesmera said as she came to a stop a couple feet away from Jonny. “What the fuck do you want?!” Jonny demanded. Lena gave a look of mock pain. “Oh don’t you like our game? I don’t blame you for now . . . fun starts soon, though,” she said with a smile.


“Fuck you!” Jonny yelled. “That’s hardly fitting language for a young lady like you, Leah,” Lena said with an arrogant smile. Jonny paused and looked down at himself. “That’s right,” she said, “it may not be quite what you possessed, but that’s the very same body—just younger,” Lena said. “What is this?!” Jonny demanded, engulfed by rage in his tiny body. “It’s our game, honey,” Lena said.


She paused for a minute as if to ponder her next words. “Let me explain,” Lena began, “what you did to Leah is really quite cruel. Think about it—you took her life. You ripped her away from her family. You crawled inside her, tore her own mind apart, and forced something else in just to make her a pawn. That seemed unfair to me, hence our game,” Lena said. “I decided that, if you want to earn that body, you have to give Leah Brady some of the experiences she never got. Some you ripped from her—others she just had to miss.”


“I still don’t know what you mean,” Jonny said angrily. “Let’s make it simple,” Lena said, “You are Leah Brady, age five. It’s 1998, and this is a memorial for your father, who died three years ago. This is an annual occasion in which your body’s family gets together to remember William Brady, taken too soon by a drug lord’s stray bullet. This is Leah’s earliest memory, so it seemed an appropriate place to start you off. You’ll make your way through this experience and live it as Leah did. Then you’ll be shuttled, invited, or maybe forced to the next one. It could be years ahead or only days or months. In each case, you will be stuck inside Leah’s body to live some experience that Leah missed as a child. If you want to live her life, you owe it to live the missed parts for her. It could be a senior prom. It could be trying out for the swim team. It could be meeting the man of her dreams of feeling the beautiful kick of a child inside your pregnant belly—an experience Leah is never likely to experience for herself if you stay inside her. We’ll see if you can survive the game with your own mind intact, Jonny, or if you’ll come out a new woman—eager to use those powers and those big, bouncing tits to help me take down my dear ‘ol Daddy,” Lena said with a smile. “And if you end up with me, I’ll get Selina and Lisa too,” she said with a smile.


Jonny’s mind swam with all that might lay before him. “Have fun, little one,” Lena said as she disappeared in a puff of purple smoke.

Lisa chuckled through her tears. "I'm hardly little anymore compared to you...You haven't aged a day, Melody" she said, eating up Lena's act.

Just as Lisa looked like she was about to lose her balance the faux-Melody hugged her tightly. "Lisa...Do you remember the day I left?"

Lisa nodded, hugging her missing sister tightly as the tears ran down her street. "I was thirteen, and you had just turned 21. You looked just like you do now. You went out to celebrate with a few of your friends. None of you came back. No one knew what happened..." she said, choking up from the memories.

"But I know what happened, Lisa" Lena said, putting her hand on Lisa's face, wiping the tears from her cheek. "Would you like to know?"

Lisa nodded. "No one ever found out where you went. We hoped you were okay..."

"Let me show you what happened" Lena said as her eyes glowed bright purple. The glow was reflected in Lisa's eyes as her body stiffened up. Lena laughed as her body and the house morphed back to normal. Now that Lena was in Lisa's mind she had won and there was no need for this act anymore. Lena placed her hand on Lisa's forehead and wiped away the mental alterations that Jonny had given to her. "How do you feel, Lisa?"

"My mind is clearer" she said. "I feel like I can think for myself again."

"Yes. That's because I've removed the controls that the demon put on you. You are yourself again. Though I've taken some liberties so that you can answer my questions. You won't be hurt, just answer me honestly, okay?"

"Sure" Lisa said, nodding. Her body now relaxed but her eyes retained a purple hue due to Lena's magical control, which was doing little more than keeping her honest and docile.

"Lisa, how do you truly feel about the demon?"

A thoughtful expression appeared on Lisa's face. "I love him" she said.

A quizzical look appeared on Lena's face. "Really? After everything he did to you, you really love him?"

Lisa nodded. "Yes. He may have controlled my mind, but he freed my from my self-imposed torture. He gave me a a purpose. And he was always kind to me" she said. It was clear that even without Jonny's controls, the emotions that Lisa felt towards him were real.

"Interesting," Lena said, looking at the woman in front of her. This could be used to her advantage. "So you love Jonny. And even without his manipulation, would I be correct in assuming that you want to remain with him? By his side?"

Again, Lisa nodded. "That's correct. I will stay with Jonny no matter what. And I'll do everything I can to help him achieve his goals."

"Well then, you should know that Jonny is working with me now" she said with a smile on her face. Of course, this wasn't quite true yet. Lena currently had Jonny entrapped in a powerful spell that was in the process of merging his spirit with the young woman who Jonny currently inhabited. Once their essences were completely brought together, the new demon-human hybrid would be trained in powerful magics as Lena's apprentice. They would then be used to kill the Old Man, finally allowing magic-users full control over the chaos magics that demons had control of for so long thanks to the Old Man. "We are going to kill the king of the demons. And then the real fun can begin. With the Old Man gone, a void will be open. And that void will be filled by the new Queen of Chaos. I'd like that queen to be you, Lisa."

"Why?" Lisa asked, looking confused.

Lena smiled. the simple answer was because she had to ensure that Jonny was susceptible to her control. Being able to fully control Jonny would require a trust between the two of them that Lena did not have. Lisa, or at least the pretense of Lisa's body, would be able to provide that since Jonny had come to love her. That love for Lisa, combined with the sense of right and wrong in Leah Brady's soul would be the ties needed for Lena to control Jonny as her soldier. Of course, Lisa couldn't just be told this. "Lisa, you said yourself that you love Jonny. He feels the same towards you. I want Jonny to be happy, so I want you to be with him."

"Why do I get the feeling that there is more to it than that?"

Lena laughed. "Oh, Lisa. How smart you are" she said. "It's really no wonder that he loves you so much. Here's the deal. If everything is to go as planned, I need you to let me into your body for a bit."

"Why? You have your own body" Lisa said, looking Lena up and down.

"Well, this body isn't exactly ideal" Lena said with a frown. "the body that I currently occupy used to belong to a woman named Kelly. I say used to, because her soul is no longer present within it. It is little more than an empty shell for me to reside in. While I can use my magics, it drains my own soul to do so. If I have a second soul within my form, I can use double the power. I can reach new heights and it will ensure victory over the demons. All I want is that victory. Once I have it, you and Jonny will reign as the kind and queen of chaos."

"Wouldn't that drain from my soul?" Lisa asked, worried.

Lena chuckled. "Good assumption, but incorrect. While I possess you, our souls will be interwoven. The magic will still come from me, but you will be like a battery, keeping my soul alive enough to replenish itself after I use my full power. That's all I need from you, Lisa."

"And why don't you just possess me now? Why do I need to agree to this?"

"Good question. The short answer is that I'm not a demon so I can't take what I want without permission like they can. The long answer is because I respect you too much to try anything funny."

Lisa smiled a bit. It was strange being talked to like she was an equal. "I don't know..." she said, still unsure if she could trust this woman.

"Lisa, I realized that I never showed you what happened to your sister. Let me clear that up" she said, placing her hand on Lisa's forehead again. Both womens eyes glowed bright purple as memories entered Lisa's head. Lisa saw her sister and her friends entering a bar to party. Then a bunch of people came to them. They were brought into a back room for some more fun, when suddenly black smoke left the men' bodies. Lisa's sister and her friends were all possessed by the group of demons and then left the bar to continue their fun. Nothing else was shown, but it didn't take much to realize that Melody and her friends were likely discarded after having their souls devoured by the demons that took them for a joyride. "Now Lisa , are you sure you don't want to help me end this?"

Tears had reformed in Lisa's purple twinged eyes. She clenched her fists tightly as an anger burned in her stronger than she had ever felt. "I'll do whatever you need me to do. Just kill the demons" she said.

Lena smiled. She had no idea what really happened to Lisa's sister, but the narrative that she created had accomplished its goal of getting Lisa on her side. "I look forward to working with you, Lisa. Or should I say, As you" Lena said with a grin. Her body suddenly became consumed in purple flames as her essence flew towards Lisa. Lisa's body shook violently as Lena forced her way into control. Purple energy burned around Lisa's body as Lena's soul was imprinted over Lisa's. Lena had, of course, also lied to Lisa about what would happen after being possessed. Lisa's soul would not be a simply an extra battery. It was being assimilated into Lena's essence. Lisa was ceasing to exist to give Lena access to more spiritual energy.

Soon enough, there was no trace of Lisa's spirit left. It was only Lena, and she was more powerful than she had ever been before. Lisa's eyes opened, revealing a bright purple energy where Lisa's hazel eyes had once been. "Mmm, this will do nicely. Now that I've been supercharged by assimilating a soul, I think I'm rady for the next part of my plan" she said as she teleport her new body back into Selina's office. The curvaceous police chief was still asleep on the floor and the two crystal balls, one containing the Old Man and one containing Jonny were on her desk, untouched. Lena/Lisa picked up the ball containing Jonny and grinned. Soon, Jonny and Leah's souls would be completely merged. After today, neither Jonny nor Lisa would exist anymore. Jonny's essence would still exist in the form of Lena's new apprentice, Leah and Lisa's essence would still exist as part of Lena. Aside from that the two would be gone forever. The final casualties in Lena's war against the Old Man and his demons.

Suddenly, Lisa's body transformed into purple smoke and flew into Selina's mouth. Selina's body put up no fight allowing Lena to regain control. The possessed Selina then opened her eyes and stood up, stretching since she was now stiff. "And now I have three souls to draw power from. That should be more than enough to begin" she said as she walked to 'her' desk and picked up the ball containing Jonny/Leah. A purple glow surrounded the ball as Jonny's conditioning entered its final phase.
