135122211112211111111122112212222.content:
The Old Man looked off into space for a moment, seeming to be contemplating something in his head—trying to take it in. “Hey!?” Jonny screamed. He snapped back to reality and looked at Jonny. “Apologies boy, but I must warn the others. Be careful!” he said urgently as the Old Man walked away in obvious haste and simply disappeared in a puff of smoke. Jonny stood there on the hilltop for a few moments as the mid-day sun shone down upon him in his curvy, well-endowed vessel. “Just fucking great . . . “ Jonny mused to himself as he glanced about in disgust at the lack of help he had been given. “Thanks for the help dumbass!” he yelled out. He stood again to await a response. None came. Jonny stood still longer upon the vacant hilltop. Who was this new woman? Was she a demon? A witch? She had seemed to temporarily posses the people Jonny bumped into on the way to the bathroom—surely she could do much more. Could she posses people without Jonny’s even knowing? Could she posses the same bodies Jonny did, leaving him powerless inside the meat suits he had sought to control? All the possibilities troubled him.


Deciding none of that would be resolved now, Jonny’s voluptuous body disappeared in a puff of smoke and quickly reappeared in the same bathroom in the police station from which he had come. Jonny glanced around under the fluorescent lighting of the bathroom. No one else seemed present. He took a look at the body of Leah Brady, making a couple faces in the mirror and running his hands over his ample chest. He looked into the reflection in the mirror, addressing Leah herself. “You’re mine until I feel like climbing out of you, honey,” he said with a smile as he turned and walked from the bathroom.


Emerging again into the police station, Jonny began a walk through the main corridor in the direction of Selina’s office so that he could be told what he had to do next. It was just the middle of the day, after all, and Jonny still wanted to hang around for a bit longer. Still, the whole experience was new. Before, Jonny had known he was king of the roost. Now, every step he took brought the pleasant jiggle of Leah’s breasts, but also the disquieting thought that the next step would bring him into contact with witch—maybe Jonny would not even know this person when he saw her? Or might the witch actually posses a male body? Who knew?


“Leah!” Jonny hard from behind him as he walked. He spun around to see Selina walking toward him quickly. “Chief?” Jonny answered. Selina beheld Jonny carefully. “I ah, I saw you duck out of the meeting earlier . . . you didn’t look so good—you ok?” she asked. Jonny smiled. “Yeah, I’m fine . . . just a bit light-headed,” Jonny lied. “Well how about we go get some grub? You’ll feel better after you get some food in your belly, and consider it payment for a job well done with that hooker today,” Selina said with a smile. Jonny quickly agreed, and the two women walked out of the police station and got into Selina’s car. The two made small talk while they headed for the restaurant, and the journey passed pleasantly enough.


Selina pulled the car into a small diner and rolled to a stop. As Jonny got out, he thought that the diner looked like some place out of the 1950s—everything was chrome, there was a Juke Box inside, and pictures of Buddy Holly and Jerry Lee Lewis adorned the walls. Presumably their tunes were the ones that filled the juke box. Jonny smiled a bit at the charm of the place. The two women walked in and sat down at a booth, with each marveling a bit at the old-time trinkets that covered the walls and shrouded the whole place in a pleasant air of a simpler time.


“I like this place,” Selina said, “they have wonderful burgers, and the atmosphere is nice.” A waiter quickly arrived to take their orders. “I’ll have a double-decker burger with steak fries and a milk shake,” Jonny announced, and the waiter scribbled it on his writing pad. Selina looked thoughtful for a moment, and then she ordered only a small order of fries and a diet Coke, and the waiter left. “Where do you put it all honey?” Selina asked her companion. Jonny smiled knowingly. Leah had a nice body, but Jonny figured he’d eat what he damn well wanted after today’s ordeal and let the real Leah worry about the damage he might do to her diet. “Let’s just say I can change my look in a jiffy if I need to boss,” Jonny said with a smile. “How about you? You say this place has great burgers, and they you don’t get one?”


Selina smiled and blushed a little. “Well—well I shouldn’t eat a bunch because it’s already 2 and I have, you know, that thing tonight with—um—that guy,” she said nervously. Jonny’s vessel smiled. “Oh yeah I’m sure he’s a real cutie. Tell me all about him,” he said. Selina laughed, obviously blushing. She paused. She paused again. She didn’t know where to start. “I, ah, well there’s this guy and he’s really great,” she said with a dreamy smile on her face, “um, and I just met him not too long ago, and he took me to the beach at night. It was the most romantic date I’ve ever been on, and he held me and I fell asleep in his arms,” she explained. “Sounds like a real catch,” Jonny said self-servingly. “Yeah,” Selina said, a hint of reservation in her voice. “But?” Jonny asked, sensing one was coming. Selina paused again. The waiter brought their food, and the two women began to eat, Jonny tearing voraciously into his burger.


“Well he’s not really my a—“ Selina began, and then cut herself off, trying to come up with a more artful way to say what she wanted. “I don’t know if my friends and family would accept—well—me, and well you know I’m in my forties, and—“ she stuttered as she chomped on a fry. Jonny looked straight into Selina’s eyes. “Do you like him?” he asked. Immediately, Selina smiled and nodded vigorously. “Yes,” she said. “And does he like you?” Jonny pressed. Selina paused. “I—I think so . . . he had a great time. Great enough that he wants to see me again in a few hours.” Leah’s face broke into a smile. “Then that’s all you need to know,” she said simply. Selina thought about it and nodded with a smile. “You’re damn right,” she said as she sipped her diet coke. “Of course I am girl,” Jonny said.


The two were suddenly interrupted by a hurried message from dispatch. “Chief,” came the call over the shoulder-mounted communication device, “there’s a situation at the university in Wilkins Hall . . . you’re close. Can you check it out?” “Can do,” Selina said quickly as she wiped her mouth with a napkin and waited for Leah to scarf down the last of her burger. “Game time rookie!” Selina said as the two women headed to the car. The two hopped in, and Selina sped the car toward the source of the trouble.

Jonny sat in the car, his eyes darting about as the engine revved and the siren wailed. Jonny’s host’s heart beat quickly on her well-endowed chest. Jonny felt himself become suddenly jumpy, like a rider waiting for a roller coaster to start. “Maybe it’s just this body,” Jonny thought silently to himself, “but I sort of like this.” Within a few minutes, the car arrived at a school not too far from the restaurant. The campus was situated upon a beautiful set of green, rolling hills nestled into a small suburb that teamed with the life of a college enclave. Bars and school supplies places, many proudly displaying the school’s logo, dotted the street corners.


The two women got out of the car and were met by a well-dressed but frantic woman who greeted them and led them in the direction of the trouble. “I’m Delores Duckworth, head of the Classics Department. Please come this way,” the frumpy woman said as she shook the hands of the officers. “What seems to be the problem, mam?” Jonny asked, taking the initiative and enjoying his role as an authority figure. “It’s Arnold Chubman, one of our professors,” she said as she led the women into an academic building and quickly up the stairs to a row of what seemed to be professors’ offices. “He’s been a bit eccentric for a number of years now, weird really, but always a nice man and a fine scholar. He’s gone a bit overboard and barricaded himself in his office, and he won’t come out,” the woman explained as the three reached the door bearing the strange professor’s strange name. “Arnie, open the door, will you?” the woman called as she tried the handle to no avail. No sound came from within the office.


“His office also has a stairway that leads to the roof of the building,” Duckworth said, “he may have gone up there.” Selina paused for a minute as she tried to figure out what to do. “Okay,” she said, “some of these buildings have an old maintenance ladder or some external access to the roof for safety purposes, so I’m going to go try to find one of those. Leah, you stay here and try to get into the office. Call one of the maintenance guys and tell him to bring a key, and the minute the good Dr. Chubworth feels inclined to come out, I want to know about it,” Selina said. “Right boss,” Jonny said, and with that Selina ran off, jiggling beautifully all the way.

1351222111122111111111221122122221.content:
Jonny stood quietly with the old woman. This whole thing seemed strange. Why would a tenured professor, a guy who one might think would have his proverbial shit together, suddenly go nuts and barricade himself in his office (or maybe on the roof) and not come out? “So can you tell me about this man? Do you have any idea what might have made him snap?” Jonny asked. Delores Duckworth paused. “Arnie’s always been a strange bird, and I suppose academia attracts those sometimes. The last few years, he’s spent all the more time with his nose shoved in his books. He’ll go into his office and not come out for days—sleep there even. He never misses a class, but sometimes in the summers he’ll disappear for weeks at a time. No one knows where he goes,” Duckworth said. “I think he went off the reservation enough that his wife left him, and he just couldn’t handle it anymore,” she postulated.


Jonny mulled this over in his head. He’d used his powers earlier this very day, he noted, and even a body as beautiful as Leah’s was of limited use if he confined himself to only the human methods of crime-solving. Being a demon had its advantages. Leah’s eyes glowed red as Jonny raised his hand. Delores had her back to the officer at the moment, and Jonny laid his hand firmly on her shoulder. “Delores,” he began, her eyes glowing red too and her body relaxing, “I’ve got to use some unconventional methods here, and I can’t have you seeing what I do, so you’re going to remember this as a time when I used this beautiful, curvy body of mine to force my way through the door as a part of a heroic effort to save the professor, and you’re going to make sure you tell my boss what I did. What’s actually going to happen, though, is that you’re going to go to sleep while I do my work,” he said. “Curvy body . . . door . . . sleep,” Delores mumbled just as her body collapsed limply to the floor of the hallway. She lay there unconscious.


Jonny turned toward the door. “And off I go,” Jonny said as his vessel disappeared in a puff of black smoke. He reappeared just a few feet away on the other side of the door to the office. Jonny looked about the at dusty and crusty old room, filled to the brim with ungraded papers and journal articles and books with yellowed pages. “Chubworth?” Jonny called out. No answer. “What have you been up to prof?” Jonny asked the absent professor as he rummaged about the cluttered office. More strangeness abounded. Jonny looked about and saw strange symbols scrawled on the walls of the darkened room. He didn’t know what they were, but they looked old. They looked magical.


A sudden breeze blew through the room, and Jonny jumped. He saw the source of the air. An old wooden door in the corner of the room had blown open, and Jonny could see stairs leading up from that door, presumably to the roof. “The plot thickens,” Jonny said as he headed for the stairs. The tiny hairs on the back of Leah’s neck stood up. Her pulse quickened. Sweat rolled down her head. “I definitely picked the right meat suit,” Jonny mused to himself as he slowly ascended the dark stairwell. Each step brought a creek from the old wooden stairs. As Jonny climbed slowly and as quietly as he could, more wild writing and symbols could be seen. “Get out of me!” commanded one big of script. “Body . . . MINE!” read another.


Jonny reached the top of the steps and another old wooden door. “Here goes nothing,” he said as he kicked the door and it flew open with a loud crack. Jonny stepped quickly on to the gravel-strewn roof of the building. This building was fairly tall, and so the wind blew fairly strongly up here. Leah’s hair blew about in the breeze. Over toward the edge of the roof, Jonny beheld a second figure, who quickly spun around in surprise.


This figure was male, and he seemed to be in his early sixties. He had very thick glasses adorning his face, and he was small of stature, probably no taller than five feet five inches. That said, he probably weighed some three hundred pounds, and a gigantic belly jiggled as he moved, peeking over the top of his pants and barely contained by an old, winkled dress shirt that seemed destined to soon lose the last of its original buttons. His trousers were tasked with containing the remainder of his gut, having been pulled up so far as to house rolls of belly fat acquired over decades of sedentary work. The man had a mass of thick grey hair that seemed not to have seen a comb since some time early in the Clinton Administration, and his wild eyes darted about at the surprise occasioned by his new guest.


“Who are you?!” the man called out as if to an intruder. “That’s a bit complicated,” Jonny said, “why don’t you just call me Leah?” he introduced his stolen body, “and I presume you’re Dr. Chubworth?” The man seemed to relax ever so slightly. “It’s—it’s ah, well it’s Arnie. F—fr—friends, they call me Arnie,” he stuttered. “Hi, Arnie,” Jonny said as he stepped a bit closer, “so what is it you’re doing up here?” he said in a quiet soothing voice that he was thankful this body just seemed to naturally have.


Arnie paused, and tears started to stream down his face as he ran his hand through his crazy hair. “You’re not going to believe me lady,” he cried, “no—nobody’s gonna believe me at all!” he said. “I’ve got a pretty good imagination, Arnie. Why don’t you just try me?” Jonny said. Arnie paused, seeming to ponder the proposal as he wiped his nose with the ruffled sleeve of his shirt. Without saying anything, Arnie slowly waddled (as a man of his build must) over to a metal air conditioning unit and plopped his considerable girth down upon it. Jonny very slowly made his way over there two, and sat Leah’s beautiful backside upon the same surface a few feet away. He looked over at Arnie, who wiped tears from his face as he collected his thoughts.


“Few years ago . . . I found this book that says it’s got all these rituals for talking to people on other planes of existence. Creatures. The dead. Demons, whatever I suppose,” Arnie started. “I had read some articles about this sort of thing before, so I thought it was interesting, and one night I went into my attic at home and, and ah, ‘an I did what the book said to do, you know? I drew a few symbols, and I lit a few candles and stuff, and I read the script in the book while I sat in the middle of this big circle,” he explained. Jonny nodded, interested. “I sat up there for what turned out to be hours and listened into the void, sort of the space between worlds the book said, and I didn’t hear anything at all. I thought it was a all made-up, maybe somethin’ get a conference talk or an article out of, but nothing real,” Arnie said.


“Then, as I was about to go to bed and give up, I heard this faint voice,” he explained, “this woman . . . seemed far away or like a voice you hear only a little bit through a strong wind. The voice asked me my name, so I told her . . . said she needed my help,” said Chubworth. “Your help?” Jonny asked, “help with what?” “I wasn’t sure at first, but we just talked. She said she was somewhere she wasn’t supposed to be . . . been marooned somewhere and couldn’t get home, so I felt bad. She asked if we could be friends, and I said yes,” he said with a slight smile. “She told me she had to go and I should come back the next night, so I left that attic, and it turned out I had been up there most of the night, which I didn’t know. It was getting light out already . . . I went and taught class all day, but I couldn’t think about anything other than this voice. I couldn’t tell anyone . . . she told me not to,” Arnie said.


“So you didn’t tell anybody at all?” Jonny asked. Arnie shook his head vigorously. “No, never, ahh, I, um, well, I—so I just went right home after class and, in the evening, after my wife was asleep, I went back up to attic and did the ritual again, and there she was again, the woman—the voice,” Arnie said.


As the minutes passed by, Arnie explained that this ritual—go to class in the morning, come home, talk to the voice alone at night—went on for a couple weeks. Arnie said the woman was always nice to him and wanted to learn about him. The woman explained that she had been banished long ago and was stuck in a world that was her prison. She said she wanted to come back to our world, but that she couldn’t just come all the way back yet—she needed a body. She wanted to get her body back, and that would take time. She began to ask Arnie to get things and to do certain magical spells for her—things that would prepare for her return. Arnie always dutifully did as he was asked. Jonny thought that Arnie truly enjoyed the companionship of this absent woman, who really seemed interested in him and seemed genuinely kind to him. Eventually, the woman’s requests of Arnie went to another level.


“She, um, she said she could maybe start to come back if I would help her,” Arnie explained. “I thought I’d already been helping her, so I didn’t understand. I was doing all the stuff she wanted me to do to reconstitute her body. Then she told me that would take too long and she wanted to try to come back now, at least for a bit . . . said that she didn’t have to use her body, that she could use mine instead . . . temporarily,” Arnie said. Jonny looked Arnie up and down—his was certainly not the sort of body Jonny would pick, but to each his or her own. “She—she asked if she could posses your body?” Jonny asked. Arnie nodded. “Yes . . . said I had to go mix this concoction to let his posses me, so I did, and then I drank it like she told me to do. I looked in the mirror after I did it, and I didn’t look or feel any different except for this little bit of a purple glow in my eyes,” Arnie said.


Jonny immediately took notice. He’d seen the purple glow before.

13512221111221111111112211221222211.content:
“I stood in the attic and looked into the mirror . . . suddenly it felt like I was being watched. It was like something or someone was there with me, and I blacked out. I woke up an hour later feeling as well as I’d felt in years. I was in my office when I woke up. I don’t know what she did while she was inside my body, but I felt great after. She even wrote a note and put it in my pocket—“thanks Arnie, back soon”—I think it said,” he explained.


Arnie went on to explain how this woman possessed his body for a brief time at first—often for a few hours at a time during the school year. Arnie was sort of asleep as long as he was possessed, though he would get little glimpses here and there. She apparently took his body to a number of occult stores in the area and also to several recreational things—restaurants, movies, even a couple strip clubs. She would leave notes thanking him every time, and he would destroy them so that his wife would never ask questions. Arnie felt great every time after she left. Then, as the possessions continued, they got longer—much longer. They went from a few hours at a time to a couple days or even a week at a time. Each time, Arnie got only bits and pieces, and sometimes quite few of those. No one ever said anything about Arnie’s acting weird or anything, and Arnie enjoyed the respite from daily life. Having her inside him just felt right.


“Then she stopped coming one day,” Arnie said sadly, “she was gone. I would wait for her to come, but she never did. One night in August about 2 years ago, I was sitting with my wife Joanna on the porch . . . she had made chocolate chip cookies. A man built like me shouldn’t have those, but I love them,” Arnie said. “Anyway, we were sitting on the porch swing eating them, and suddenly my wife, my Joanna, she looked up at me and said ‘It’s been nice getting to know you in person, Arnie,’ and suddenly her eyes glowed this bright purple color, and she passed out.”


“You mean the woman from before possessed her body?” Jonny asked. Arnie nodded as his pudgy little hands clenched into fists. “When my wife woke up, she thought it was early June!” Arnie said, barely containing his anger, “that woman had possessed my wife’s body for literally months! I was prepared to have the woman jump into my body, but my wife never asked for this . . . she thought she’d gone nuts because she didn’t remember much of anything—just bits and pieces—from the last three months. She damn near had a nervous breakdown!” Arnie said. “After that, I looked through all the books I could find to stop her from possessing even my body . . . I didn’t want her in me anymore, but I couldn’t stop her. She started to posses me again. She’d leave notes in my pockets too—‘Aren’t you enjoying the game you fat little bastard?’ or something similar,” he said, “and she’d stay inside me for weeks at a time . . . started using my body to commit petty crimes, and my relationship with Joanna grew worse,” he explained.


Arnie’s life had spiraled out of control from there. info.brief_description: A group of all powerful demons are set free after being imprisoned for several years.
info.description:
The story focuses on four demons who were trapped in sealed room several years ago. The demons all used to be humans who became evil and gained powers that eventually made them lose all of their humanity. They have the power to possess living bodies and eat people's souls to keep themselves alive. The soulless bodies become their unquestioning slaves without any free will or emotion. When possessed, their hosts bodies pupils become a glowing red briefly but other demons can see whenever they look at them. After leaving a body the host will have no memories of their time possessed.

Cast Of Characters:
Kal Snyder: A former mafia boss, who became a demon through a curse by one of his victims. the leader of the group with all of the powers of a demon plus the ability to create demon clones of himself that can do everything he can and think of themselves as him, but all serve him unquestioningly. He is corrupt and only wants more power, money and women.

Jonny Macks: A former cop who accidentally killed an innocent old man. Before dying the man cursed him to becoming a demon. He has all basic demon powers. He is the only one of the four with a conscience and refuses to feed on souls unless he absolutely needs to survive. While trapped he saw that his family moved on and forgot about him and became as corrupt and angry as the others. His unique powers are a mystery even to him, though the old man had to prevent him from being able to use it so it must be powerful.

Billy and Lizzie Calhoun: A southern couple who are madly in love with each other. they became demons by accidently reading from a cursed spell book. They have all basic demon powers as well as certain powers unique to them. Billy can alter anyone's body in anyway he wants while Lizzie can alter their minds. The two are very creative with their powers and their main goal is to have fun with each other. They are rarely serious and always ready for a good time.

The Old Man: A mysterious figure who is responsible for trapping the demons in the room. Little is known about him aside from that he is the same man Johnny "killed",the "victim" who cursed Kal and the man who sold the Calhouns their book. Once the demons were trapped he explained to them the full scope of their powers and disappeared. He is sometimes seen watching the demons after they are freed and is the one responsible for orchestrating their freedom. He has mysterious powers of his own that are never fully explained, though it is assumed he is a demon as well.

Kevin: A teenage demon recently created by the old man. He does things on his own and is not a member of the original group. Young and with a thirst for chaos and violence, he greatly admires and willingly serves the old man.

All Chapters must be at a five paragraphs in length and well written. Please use proper punctuation and capitalization. Have as much fun as you like with the chapters and story but please do not take things too far. The story needs to be able to move forward. Anything I find unsuitable for the story will be edited.
